conclusion: Analyze the Stirling cycle and properties of an ideal gas.
The Stirling cycle consists of two isothermal and two adiabatic processes.
In an isothermal process, the temperature remains constant.
In an adiabatic process, there is no heat exchange with the surroundings.
For an isothermal process, work done by the gas equals heat absorbed.
During process A→B, the gas absorbs heat to maintain constant temperature.
The gas absorbs heat when moving from state A to state B.
